newsitem.title: GERMANY: Beta to issue 200,000 more shares in float.
newsitem.headline: Beta to issue 200,000 more shares in float.

text.p: German software group Beta Systems said on Thursday that it planned to issue 200,000 further five-mark shares in its forthcoming flotation because of the high demand for shares.

These will be added to the 780,000 shares already for sale within the parameters of the bookbuilding process, which lasts until June 26. Shares in the IPO will be priced between 85 and 100 marks in the bookbuilding process.

The group also said in a statement that it was planning to rise the amount of shares in its "greenshoe option", which allows additional shares to be sold if demand is strong, by 30,000 shares to 147,000.
Pricing on the German bourse is set for June 30.
